creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
Thanks for posting the bug, I'm not sure why you're seeing that problem. That
error looks like it's a bug in AWT event queue, which is a bit odd. Which JDK
are you using?

I just tried loading the JTL file and it worked fine for me. I'm using
jdk1.4.2_08. other information that would help diagnose the problem is the
system specs.

cpu speed
ram
jvm version
jre version

peter

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
Wow, that's a nice system. The only thing I can think of is try jdk1.4.2. I've
used jdk1.5 without any problems on my 1.4ghz centrino laptop and it works fine.
I  haven't tested it with a dual processor system, so I have no idea if it's
caused by dual processors. A quick google search turns up this.

http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=5090943

peter

yeah, but its only got a 15" monitor :-(

Ill download the source and try debugging it locally when I get a min. Thats the
only snag Ive hit. Very nice tool - intuitive - does what it says on the tin - btw
creator: martin.2.west@bt.com

text:
Just tried loading the report in JMeter 2.3RC3, and I get:


java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 2
at org.apache.jmeter.visualizers.GraphAccum.drawSample(GraphAccum.java:361)
at org.apache.jmeter.visualizers.GraphAccum.paintComponent(GraphAccum.java:235)
at javax.swing.JComponent.paint(JComponent.java:808)
...

so the problem is still present, and can be reproduced.

I'll try to fix it.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Problem seems to be caused by nested samples - e.g. such as created by using 
follow redirects; ordinary samples are OK.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
The problem is in the Graph Full Results Listener, which never supported 
nested samples. It also seems to be broken for ordinary samples.

Note that the Tutorial actually specifies the Graph Results Listener, which 
works OK.
creator: sebb@apache.org
